intro: Bunium microcarpum subsp. longiradiatum, commonly known as the long-rayed fennel, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy scent, while its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated, radiating bracts, which contribute to its unique appearance.
